pull.title: [0.12] gitian: Set reference date to something more recent
pull.body: This also helps in file views where binaries are sorted by time (be656283f98896df0bc8634d446b2873f9fed573)

events.body:
Test build: https://bitcoin.jonasschnelli.ch/pulls/7251/
Seems not to work.... maybe my gitian builder can't handle the new .yml files?

events.message: [gitian] Set reference date to something more recent

events.body:
Sorry, mea culpa! I must not set `reference_datetime` to some future date.

```
checking whether build environment is sane... configure: error: newly created file is older than distributed files!
Check your system clock
```

rename.from: [0.12] gitian: Set reference date to actual release date
rename.to: [0.12] gitian: Set reference date to something more recent

events.body:
utACK
This is only (externally visibly) used for file timestamps in and on the produced archives, so it doesn't hurt changing it as long as it is deterministic.
Merged via eb2b745 (somehow github doesn't detect it?)

> @laanwj somehow github doesn't detect it

This was for 0.12 and master is already on 0.13, so GitHub did it right. It doesn't hurt to have it in master as well.
